Subject: Congrats! You get VIP access to our latest Release - JetBrains Integration
Body:
Hi RUDRA, 
 People are going crazy with the latest release of our JetBrains Plugin. It is now live and available for free for everyone on all the 17 JetBrains IDEs! 
 This new release brings a host of exciting updates and improvements that will take your coding capabilities to the next level. 
 GET FREE ACCESS NOW 
 [Image "7.png?expires=1751410836&signature=e988986631e40fe87a9b213777c19e57aed8f9e16448a0aa176e1bbaf9808112&req=dSIkEs54nYBfXfMW2XS%2FicJCSFsDCvY3KWixcwJbMubtNjW6EGg%3D%0A"] 
 To get started, simply: 
 1. Go to Blackbox.ai 
2. Click the "JetBrains" on the top right 
3. And you're all set 
 GET FREE ACCESS NOW 
 Your Feedback Matters 
 We're committed to continuously improving and expanding BLACKBOX AI. Your feedback is invaluable in helping us shape the future of our products. Please reply to this email or reach out to our support team with any questions, suggestions, or ideas you may have. 
 Thank you for being part of the BLACKBOX AI community! 
 Best regards, 
 BLACKBOX AI Team 
 P.S. Don't forget to follow us on social media to stay up-to-date with the latest news, updates, and tips from BLACKBOX AI!

Subject: THN Recap: Top Cybersecurity Threats, Tools and Tips (Dec 2 - 8)
Body:
Cybersecurity Newsletters

By The Hacker News


By The Hacker News

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/thn-recap-top-cybersecurity-threats-tools-tips-dec-2-8-vo3mc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BlAMNKEDqS%2BOGIIfS3cVI8Q%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=19HQdMZ2eeWHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m4h3tnmp~6f-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4h3tnmp-6f&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0YjM4YWNkZDI0MDlmYWU4NjZkN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NjVlZmVjODY3ZDgzZGNiMjRkODZkYmUzMzFmZGY4YTRjNTQ3OGU3ZDQxN2UwZThiLDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
This week’s cyber world is like a big spy movie. Hackers are breaking into other hackers’ setups, sneaky malware is hiding in popular software, and AI-powered scams are tricking even the smartest of us. On the other side, the good guys are busting secret online markets and kicking out shady chat rooms, while big companies rush to fix new security holes before attackers can jump in. Want to know who’s hacking who, how they’re doing it, and what’s being done to fight back? Stick around—this recap has the scoop. ⚡ Threat of the Week Turla Hackers Hijack Pakistan Hackers' Infrastructure — Imagine one hacker group sneaking into another hacker group’s secret hideout and using their stuff to carry out their own missions. That’s basically what the Russia-linked Turla group has been doing since December 2022. They broke into the servers of a Pakistani hacking team called Storm-0156 and used those servers to spy on government and military targets in Afghanistan and India. By doing this, Turla not only got easy access to important information but also made it way harder for anyone to figure out who was actually running the show. This is a classic move for Turla—they often hijack other hackers’ operations to hide their tracks and make it super confusing to tell who’s really behind these attacks. 10 Steps to Microsoft 365 Cyber Resilience 75% of organizations get hit by cyberattacks, and most report getting hit more than once. Read this ebook to learn 10 steps to take to build a more proactive approach to securing your organization’s Microsoft 365 data from cyberattacks and ensuring cyber resilience ➟ Read Now 🔔 Top News Ultralytics and @solana/web3.js Libraries Targeted by Supply Chain Attacks — In two separate incidents, unknown threat actors managed to push malicious versions of the popular Ultralytics library for Python and @solana/web3.js package for npm that contained code to drop a cryptocurrency miner and a drainer, respectively. The maintainers have since released updated versions to address the issue.  New Android Malware DroidBot Targets Over 70 Financial Institutions — Dozens of banking institutions, cryptocurrency exchanges, and national organizations have become the target of a newly discovered Android remote access trojan (RAT) called DroidBot. The malware is capable of gathering a wide range of information from compromised devices. A majority of the campaigns distributing the malware have targeted users in Austria, Belgium, France, Italy, Portugal, Spain, Turkey, and the United Kingdom. DroidBot has been observed operating under a malware-as-a-service (MaaS) model for a monthly fee of $3,000. A Busy Week of Law Enforcement Actions — Europol last week announced the disruption of a clearnet marketplace called Manson Market that facilitated online fraud on a large scale by acting as a hub for stolen financial information. A 27-year-old and a 37-year-old have been arrested in Germany and Austria, respectively, in connection with the operation. They are currently in pretrial detention. Separately, the law enforcement agency said it also dismantled an invite-only encrypted messaging service called MATRIX that's created by criminals for criminal purposes, including drug trafficking, arms trafficking, and money laundering. Tibetans and Uyghurs Become the Target of Earth Minotaur — A newly christened threat activity cluster dubbed Earth Minotaur has been found leveraging the MOONSHINE exploit kit to deliver a new backdoor called DarkNimbus as part of long-term surveillance operations targeting Tibetans and Uyghurs. In the attack chains documented by Trend Micro, the attackers leveraged WeChat as a conduit to deploy the backdoor. The use of MOONSHINE has been previously linked to other groups like POISON CARP and UNC5221, suggesting some kind of tool sharing. Salt Typhoon Guidance Issued — Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and the U.S. issued a joint guidance for organizations to safeguard their networks against threats posed by Salt Typhoon, which has been recently linked to a spate of cyber attacks directed against telecommunication companies in the U.S., including AT&T, T-Mobile, and Verizon. As many as eight telecom companies in the U.S., with dozens of other nations, are estimated to be affected as a result of the campaign. Malware Campaign Leverages Corrupt Word and ZIP Files — New phishing campaigns ongoing since at least August 2024 have been taking advantage of corrupted Microsoft Office documents and ZIP archives as a way to bypass email defenses. "By manipulating specific components like the CDFH and EOCD, attackers can create corrupted files that are successfully repaired by applications but remain undetected by security software," ANY.RUN said. ‎️‍🔥 Trending CVEs Heads up! Some popular software has serious security flaws, so make sure to update now to stay safe. The list includes — CVE-2024-41713 (Mitel MiCollab), CVE-2024-51378 (CyberPanel), CVE-2023-45727 (Proself), CVE-2024-11680 (ProjectSend), CVE-2024-11667 (Zyxel), CVE-2024-42448 (Veeam), CVE-2024-10905 (SailPoint IdentityIQ), CVE-2024-5921 (Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect), CVE-2024-29014 (SonicWall), CVE-2014-2120 (Cisco Adaptive Security Appliance), CVE-2024-20397 (Cisco NX-OS), CVE-2024-52338 (Apache Arrow), CVE-2024-52316 (Apache Tomcat), CVE-2024-49803, CVE-2024-49805 (IBM Security Verify Access Appliance), CVE-2024-12053 (Google Chrome), CVE-2024-38193 (Microsoft Windows), and CVE-2024-12209 (WP Umbrella: Update Backup Restore & Monitoring plugin). 📰 Around the Cyber World Researchers Debut New VaktBLE Framework — A group of academics from the ASSET (Automated Systems SEcuriTy) Research Group at the Singapore University of Technology and Design has unveiled a novel jamming technique called VaktBLE that can be used to defend against low-level Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) attacks. "VaktBLE presents a novel, efficient, and (almost) deterministic technique to silently hijack the connection between a potentially malicious BLE central and the target peripheral to be protected," the researchers explained. "This creates a benevolent man-in-the-middle (MiTM) bridge that allows us to validate each packet sent by the BLE central." (Please embed this video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RhDDp_HExsk) FBI Warns of AI-Enabled Financial Fraud — The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is warning that cybercriminals are exploiting generative artificial intelligence (AI) to generate synthetic content and commit fraud at scale. This comprises the use of AI tools to produce realistic images, audio, and video clips of people, celebrities, and topical events; generate fraudulent identification documents; create fictitious social media profiles; craft convincing messages; assist with language translation; generate content for counterfeit websites; and even embed chatbots that aim to trick victims into clicking on malicious links. "Criminals use AI-generated text to appear believable to a reader in furtherance of social engineering, spear-phishing, and financial fraud schemes such as romance, investment, and other confidence schemes or to overcome common indicators of fraud schemes," the FBI said. Lateral Movement Techniques on macOS — Cybersecurity researchers have highlighted the different ways threat actors are exploiting SSH, Apple Remote Desktop, and Remote Apple Events (RAE) to facilitate lateral movement on Apple macOS systems. "Lateral movement refers to the techniques cyber attackers use to navigate through a network after compromising an initial system," Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 said. "This phase is crucial for attackers to achieve their ultimate objectives, which might include data exfiltration, persistence or further system compromise." The disclosure comes as new research has revealed how the legitimate Windows Event Logs utility wevtutil.exe could be exploited to carry out malicious activities and slip past security controls unnoticed, a technique known as living-off-the-land. "Using wevtutil.exe as part of a chain of LOLBAS utilities can further obfuscate actions," Denwp Research's Tonmoy Jitu said. "For instance, an attacker could export logs using wevtutil.exe, compress the exported file with makecab.exe, [and] use certutil.exe to upload the file to a remote location." Another Scattered Spider Hacker Arrested in the U.S. — U.S. authorities have arrested a 19-year-old teenager named Remington Goy Ogletree (aka remi) for his role in the Scattered Spider cybercrime syndicate and breaching a U.S. financial institution and two unnamed telecommunications firms. "From at least October 2023 through at least May 2024, Ogletree perpetuated a scheme to defraud in which he called and sent phishing messages to U.S.- and foreign-based company employees to gain unauthorized access to the companies' computer networks," per a complaint filed in late October 2024. "Once Ogletree had access to the victim companies' networks, Ogletree accessed and stole confidential data, including data that was later posted for sale on the dark web, and, at times, used the companies' services to facilitate the theft of cryptocurrency from unwitting victims. As a result of Ogletree's scheme, victims have suffered over $4 million in losses." The charges come weeks after the U.S. government indicted five other members of the infamous hacking crew. Scattered Spider is believed to be part of a broader loose-knit cybercrime group called The Com. According to a new report published by CyberScoop, The Com and a child sextortion sub-cluster known as 764 are engaging in financially motivated cybercrime tactics such as SIM swapping, IP grabbing, ATM skimming, and social engineering to commit violent crimes. FTC Takes Action Against 2 Data Brokers — The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has banned Virginia-based Gravy Analytics and its subsidiary Venntel from tracking and selling sensitive location data from users, including selling data about consumers' visits to health-related locations and places of worship, without their consent. It has also been ordered to establish a sensitive data location program. It's alleged that the two companies "obtained consumer location information from other data suppliers and claimed to collect, process, and curate more than 17 billion signals from around a billion mobile devices daily." The data was gathered from ordinary mobile apps, and then sold to other businesses or government agencies. Venntel's data is reportedly used by controversial surveillance company Babel Street to power its product Locate X, which can be used to precisely monitor a user's whereabouts without a warrant. The FTC also accused Mobilewalla, a Georgia-based data broker, of purposefully tracking users by collecting massive amounts of sensitive consumer data, like visits to health clinics and places of worship, from real-time bidding exchanges and third-party aggregators. "Mobilewalla exploited vulnerabilities in digital ad markets to harvest this data at a stunning scale," the FTC said. In a related move, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) proposed new rules to curb the sale of sensitive personal and financial information, such as Social Security numbers and banking details, to other parties without a legitimate reason. The development also comes as FTC announced an enforcement action against facial recognition firm IntelliVision Technologies for deceptively marketing its software as being accurate and that it "performs with zero gender or racial bias" without providing any evidence to back up its claims. 🎥 Expert Webinar Learn How Experts Secure Privileged Accounts — In this expert-led webinar, learn proven techniques for managing privileged access and stopping cyber threats before they escalate. We’ll show you how to discover hidden accounts, gain full visibility into user activities, enforce least privilege policies, and create a stronger security posture that protects your organization’s critical assets. Understanding Blind Spots in Advanced Security Systems — Discover why even well-prepared companies still experience breaches, and learn how to strengthen your defenses in this webinar with Silverfort’s CISO, John Paul Cunningham. Explore common vulnerabilities, modern threats, tactics to spot hidden risks, and strategies to align security efforts with business goals. Gain actionable insights to protect your organization. 🔧 Cybersecurity Tools Vanir Security Patch Validation Tool — Vanir is an open-source tool from Google that helps developers quickly find and fix missing security patches in their Android code. Instead of relying on version numbers or build info, Vanir compares source code to known vulnerabilities, ensuring better accuracy and coverage. By connecting with the Open Source Vulnerabilities database, Vanir always stays up-to-date. With a 97% accuracy rate, it reduces manual work, speeds up patch adoption, and helps ensure that devices receive critical security updates more quickly. garak LLM Vulnerability Scanner — garak is a free tool that scans large language models (LLMs) for weaknesses. Think of it like nmap, but for LLMs. It tries to break models by testing them with many different probes, looking for failures like hallucinations, data leaks, misinformation, or prompt injections. Each time it finds a flaw, garak logs the exact prompt, response, and reason, so you know what to fix. With dozens of plugins and thousands of tests, garak adapts over time as the community adds new, tougher challenges. 🔒 Tip of the Week Turn Your PC into a Malware ‘No-Go’ Zone — Malware often avoids running if it suspects it’s in a research lab or test environment. By placing fake clues—like virtual machine-related registry keys, empty folders named after analysis tools, or dummy drivers—on your PC, you can trick malware into thinking it’s being watched. Tools like Malcrow (open-source) and Scarecrow (free) create fake indicators—virtual machine keys, dummy processes, or tool-like entries—to fool it into retreating. This might make certain threats back off before causing harm. Although this trick isn’t perfect, it can add a subtle extra layer of security, alongside your antivirus and other defenses. Just remember to test changes carefully and keep things believable. It won’t stop every attacker, but it might deter less sophisticated malware from targeting your system. Conclusion As you think about this week’s threats, consider some less common tactics. For example, plant fake “decoy” files on your network—if someone opens them, you’ll know there’s a problem. Keep a clear record of every piece of code you use, so if something strange shows up, you can spot it right away. Also, try controlling who can talk to whom on your network, making it harder for attackers to move around. These simple steps can help you stay one step ahead in a world where cyber risks are always changing.

Subject: Opinion: Google's latest AI innovation offers a putrid vision of game development
Body:
Game Developer Digest

By Game Developer


By Game Developer

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/opinion-googles-latest-ai-innovation-offers-putrid-lekxc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bvff7blAQTUKyO%2BAN8luvsA%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=0WLCx87fAeTbw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m4df7zuz~1-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4df7zuz-1&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0YjE4Y2NlZDQ0NzkwYWY4YjZhN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5MTJjNGMyZjQwNDhlZWI5Mjc3NTEyOGFkZDlmOTI1MWYxMjQ4NjZjOWNjNjY0OWEwLDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
In today's edition, we have an opinion piece on Google's latest AI tools and game development, plus plenty of news featuring the likes of the Like a Dragon series, Square Enix, and more. Opinion: Google's latest AI innovation offers a putrid vision of game development Another supposedly life-changing AI model, another exasperated plea from a weary video game journalist. Game developers (and creatives cut from any cloth) do not aspire to create "plausible content." People (and I'm talking about the humans working on your favorite games, not their corporate employers) create to delight, inspire, entertain. We create to connect with each other and unpack our shared human condition. To create anything is to send fragments of yourself into the eternal aether, hoping that someone, somewhere, will find meaning in the deliberate, unpredictable, collaborative mess that art so often becomes. Google evidently doesn't understand how developers make games, either. There's intentionality behind every single decision, whether it's designing an open-world in service of pacing or mechanics–or baking your narrative into the very fabric of the environment. These are not elements you can simply conjure into being with a string of text or AI-generated image. Foamstars final seasonal update 'Party Goes On!' confirms the party is very much over Square Enix is mothballing the multiplayer battler after less than a year. Dragon Quest 3's HD-2D remake sells 2 million copies The 1988 RPG remake released on current consoles and PC in mid-November, and became Square Enix's biggest single-player launch on Steam. Like a Dragon devs open up on sharing source code, inspiring future programmers 'Anyone can become a game programmer as long as they have learned the basics of programming,' said technical director Yukata Ito.
Keep reading on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/opinion-googles-latest-ai-innovation-offers-putrid-lekxc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bvff7blAQTUKyO%2BAN8luvsA%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=0WLCx87fAeTbw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-j1wcht~m4df7zuz~1-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4df7zuz-1&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0YjE4Y2NlZDQ0NzkwYWY4YjZhN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5MTJjNGMyZjQwNDhlZWI5Mjc3NTEyOGFkZDlmOTI1MWYxMjQ4NjZjOWNjNjY0OWEwLDEsMQ%3D%3D

Subject: 📢 Must-Attend Webinars: From Privileged Access Protection to Breach Prevention
Body:
Cybersecurity Newsletters

By The Hacker News


By The Hacker News

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/must-attend-webinars-from-privileged-access-protection-breach-hakyc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bjfn8TlOgSfetQ5XTZtn73g%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=3zmURF_NEZSrw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m4cpi2d9~m1-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4cpi2d9-m1&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0YjA4N2M5ZDI0MDk4YTg4ZjZkN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NTRkNWM4ZTI1N2Y4ZDhjNGQ4MWU5NTE3YzQxMzVmODc0NTI3MDI4NWE1ZmU3MTU5LDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
Are your defenses as strong as you think? With evolving threats and hidden vulnerabilities, many organizations are unknowingly at risk—even those with cutting-edge solutions. These two new exclusive webinars will give you the actionable insights you need to uncover blind spots, strengthen your defenses, and outsmart attackers. 👉 Webinar 1: Preventing Privilege Escalation – Effective PAS Practices for Today’s Threat Landscape Privileged accounts are a hacker’s dream. Learn how to: 🔍 Gain full visibility into your privileged accounts 🛡️ Enforce least privilege and Just-in-Time (JIT) access 🚧 Close critical gaps that attackers rely on. 👉 Webinar 2: CISO Perspective – Why Great Companies with Great Solutions Still Get Breached Join Silverfort’s CISO, John Paul Cunningham, as he explains: ❗ Discover common vulnerabilities most companies miss. 🔓 Learn how hackers bypass advanced tools. 📊 Get actionable steps to fix blind spots and reduce risk. Ready to strengthen your defenses? Register now and protect your business from the next big attack.
Join the conversation
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/must-attend-webinars-from-privileged-access-protection-breach-hakyc?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3Bjfn8TlOgSfetQ5XTZtn73g%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=3zmURF_NEZSrw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-j1wcht~m4cpi2d9~m1-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4cpi2d9-m1&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0YjA4N2M5ZDI0MDk4YTg4ZjZkN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NTRkNWM4ZTI1N2Y4ZDhjNGQ4MWU5NTE3YzQxMzVmODc0NTI3MDI4NWE1ZmU3MTU5LDEsMQ%3D%3D

Body:
*******
For you
*******

​Dec 4, 2024

Logo ( https://app.daily.dev/ )

It's been a while since your last read
--------------------------------------

( https://app.daily.dev/posts/LMZCH4fpC?utm_source=notification&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=digest )

Lobsters ( https://app.daily.dev/posts/LMZCH4fpC?utm_source=notification&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=digest )

Why Golang slices still surprise

Subject: Gnarly content: 9 risks for horror game development
Body:
Game Developer Digest

By Game Developer


By Game Developer

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/gnarly-content-9-risks-horror-game-development-ixxxe?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3B%2Bk4xqdD5SuyhPMoBVdRRVg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=2GUuYPyRCgQbw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m4ai74za~dt-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4ai74za-dt&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0Yjc4YWNkZDk0Njk5YWQ4ZTZkN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NGZjY2MwZTI0MWJjZGZjYjgzMmZhZWY1NTQ4ZGZmNGEwMDFjMWViZGI3YzQ3NzE5LDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
In today's edition, we have a featured blog on horror game development, plus plenty of news featuring the likes of Ubisoft, Smilegate, and more. Gnarly content: 9 risks for horror game development This blog explores some of the risks of horror game development and how to address them. Horror is like metal: if you’re not into it, it all sounds the same; but for fans there are so many sub-genres. Survival horror, psychological horror, mascot horror, slasher horror, comedy horror: without even going into gameplay categories or modes, the diversity is enormous. Without a clear sense of what kind of horror you are making, your game is likely to fall between the gaps or, worse, come across as sweaty. Ubisoft kills XDefiant and closes studios in San Francisco and Osaka Half of the XDefiant team are moving onto other projects, but 277 developers will 'likely' be laid off. Killer Klowns dev Illfonic 'realigns' studio by cutting staff 'Today, we had to accept the harsh reality that the state of the industry has impacted us here at Illfonic.' Smilegate makes 'strategic investment' into Dan Houser's Absurd Ventures enterprise The two companies will learn from each other in key areas like live-service games, and may work together on one of Absurd Ventures' unannounced game projects.
Join the conversation
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/gnarly-content-9-risks-horror-game-development-ixxxe?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3B%2Bk4xqdD5SuyhPMoBVdRRVg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=2GUuYPyRCgQbw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-j1wcht~m4ai74za~dt-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4ai74za-dt&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0Yjc4YWNkZDk0Njk5YWQ4ZTZkN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NGZjY2MwZTI0MWJjZGZjYjgzMmZhZWY1NTQ4ZGZmNGEwMDFjMWViZGI3YzQ3NzE5LDEsMQ%3D%3D

Subject: 80 Level Weekly Newsletter (November 25 – December 1)
Body:
80 Level Newsletter

By 80 Level


By 80 Level

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/80-level-weekly-newsletter-november-25-december-1-80-lv-comhf?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BVdLSt578QVCKPCfy%2B7UPvg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=1vbfzSsvvLPHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m4a370mo~vc-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4a370mo-vc&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0Yjc4ZGM2ZDk0Mjk4YWY4YjY4N2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NGFlNWQwZmM3OGFlZTg5ZWFkZmYxODNmMmEyNTFlYWJlMDE2MWExMDNhNTljMGMxLDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
NEWS The Technological Reason Behind the Ribbed Suit Design in Dead Space Turns out there's a technological reason why Isaac Clarke's suit in Dead Space has ribbings. Art direction and diegesis, yes, but not just that: https://80.lv/articles/the-technological-reason-behind-the-ribbed-suit-design-in-dead-space/?utm_source=li-newsletter Fluid Flux 3.0 Arrives With a Glass System, Underwater Lighting, Decals, Rain & More Fluid Flux 3.0 for Unreal Engine 5 has been shipped, introducing a new glass system, underwater lighting, decal rendering, rain, and more. Details: https://80.lv/articles/fluid-flux-3-0-arrives-with-a-glass-system-underwater-lighting-decals-rain-more/?utm_source=li-newsletter GTA 6 Engine Will Reportedly Feature Procedural Object Generation GTA 6 engine will reportedly feature procedural object generation. Learn more: https://80.lv/articles/gta-6-engine-will-reportedly-feature-procedural-object-generation/?utm_source=li-newsletter Artists Are Concerned about One Account Stealing Sales on Blender Market Artists are concerned about one account stealing Blender Market commissions through Google ads. Learn more: https://80.lv/articles/artists-are-concerned-about-one-account-stealing-sales-on-blender-market/?utm_source=li-newsletter Mind-Blowing Jiggly Jelly Simulation Cooked With Maya's MPM Solver Morteza Ahmadi unveiled a delectable 3D jelly simulation that can wobble and jiggle and be cut with a spoon. Made in Maya with Biftost's MPM Solver: https://80.lv/articles/mind-blowing-jiggly-jelly-simulation-cooked-with-maya-s-mpm-solver/?utm_source=li-newsletter Check Out a Camera-Shy Anime-Style 3D Model That Doesn't Want to be Seen Kensyouen_Y showcased an awesome new 3D animation featuring a camera-shy anime girl who doesn't want to be seen. More info and the artist's earlier works: https://80.lv/articles/check-out-a-camera-shy-anime-style-3d-model-that-doesn-t-want-to-be-seen/?utm_source=li-newsletter INTERVIEWS How To Set Up Procedural Terrain With Unreal Engine 5.4 Alexandre Martin explained how to create a realistic environment with minimal complexity using Unreal Engine 5's native tools, detailing the workflow for generating fully procedural terrain using only two materials. Read here: https://80.lv/articles/how-to-set-up-procedural-terrain-with-unreal-engine-5-4/?utm_source=li-newsletter A Metal Bottle with a Worn Leather Sleeve Made with Blender & ZBrush Salavat Karimov shares with us a detailed breakdown of creating this metal bottle, from modeling to texturing and rendering, explaining how the effect of worn leather with realistic, rough cracks and scratches has been achieved. Full breakdown: https://80.lv/articles/a-metal-bottle-with-a-worn-leather-sleeve-made-with-blender-zbrush/?utm_source=li-newsletter How to Sculpt a Man with Exaggerated Facial Expressions in ZBrush Daniel Merticariu shared the workflow behind The Man Who Laughs project created in ZBrush, which was based on a 2D concept, explaining how his exaggerated facial expression and pose were sculpted. Learn more: https://80.lv/articles/how-to-sculpt-a-man-with-exaggerated-facial-expressions-in-zbrush/?utm_source=li-newsletter
Keep reading on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/80-level-weekly-newsletter-november-25-december-1-80-lv-comhf?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BVdLSt578QVCKPCfy%2B7UPvg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=1vbfzSsvvLPHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-j1wcht~m4a370mo~vc-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4a370mo-vc&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0Yjc4ZGM2ZDk0Mjk4YWY4YjY4N2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NGFlNWQwZmM3OGFlZTg5ZWFkZmYxODNmMmEyNTFlYWJlMDE2MWExMDNhNTljMGMxLDEsMQ%3D%3D

Subject: The Midweek Memo #046
Body:
Hitmarker | Gaming Jobs & News

By Hitmarker | Gaming Jobs


By Hitmarker | Gaming Jobs

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/midweek-memo-046-hitmarker-38def?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BPKdbv4pjQzqMgDwS7vSAww%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=2XLFtL8VKWPHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m4a11v1m~zh-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m4a11v1m-zh&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0Yjc4ZGNiZDc0NTk5YWM4YjZjN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NTFjYmMyZTA0YzgzYWE5NWRjNGQ0YWNjMjZlYzY3YTE3OWE1MTYxNWUwZjMwZTMzLDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
Ahoy 👋 This week was almost devoid of mass layoffs, then Ubisoft announced multiple studio closures affecting over 270 employees, as it shuttered its free-to-play FPS XDefiant after less than a year. 😫 Fortunately, the rest of the content in this week's Midweek Memo is more positive, with the developer of Lies of P announcing a new survival horror project and Palworld confirming it is teaming up with Terraria for an upcoming crossover! We've also seen more drama between Microsoft, Google, and Epic Games, with Xbox claiming that Google is preventing it from selling games directly through its mobile app, which has since been denied. It's safe to say this ongoing legal battle is a bit of a mess... Lastly, PlayStation is commemorating its 30th anniversary in some pretty cool ways. Aside from an excellent thank you video featuring its franchises, Sony has also updated the PS5 with some new themes inspired by previous consoles, complete with original sound effects and even the iconic PS1 startup screen. Hot Jobs 🔥 80% of this week's hottest jobs are available remotely! [1] Voice Recording Opportunity for Chinese Speakers 🏢 Lionbridge Games 🗺️ Remote Anywhere 📄 Freelance 🎚️ 0+ years exp [2] Player Support Advocate 🏢 PTW 🇺🇸 Remote US 📄 Freelance 🎚️ 0+ years exp [3] Middle QA Engineer (Mobile) 🏢 Playrix 🗺️ Remote Anywhere 📄 Full Time 🎚️ 2+ years exp [4] Studio Design Director | Age of Empires, Age of Mythology 🏢 CaptureAge 🗺️ Remote Anywhere 📄 Full Time 🎚️ 5+ years exp [5] French Game Tester 🏢 PTW 🇫🇷 Remote France 📄 Freelance 🎚️ 0+ years exp [6] Front-End Software Engineer 🏢 XBorg 🗺️ Remote Anywhere 📄 Full Time 🎚️ 2+ years exp [7] Gameplay Engineer 🏢 thatgamecompany 🇺🇸🇨🇦 Remote US/Canada 📄 Contract 🎚️ 3+ years exp [8] Game Growth SDR 🏢 Yodo1 🗺️ Remote Anywhere 📄 Full Time 🎚️ 2+ years exp [9] QA Tester 🏢 Sucker Punch 🇺🇸 Bellevue, WA 📄 Contract 🎚️ 1+ year exp [10] Trust & Safety Analyst 🏢 Twitch 🇺🇸 Los Angeles, CA 📄 Full Time 🎚️ 1+ year exp Almost 170 new opportunities have been posted in the past week, which is a significant dropoff. Thanksgiving week is always extremely slow for new vacancies, but we doubt things will pick up too much before January. Big News 📰 😬 Ubisoft lays off over 270 employees as it closes multiple studios and shuts down XDefiant Less than two months after XDefiant executive producer Mark Rubin stated that there were no plans to discontinue the first-person shooter, Ubisoft has officially pulled the plug. It has been confirmed that the decision to close the free-to-play FPS was made due to dwindling player numbers and that its servers will be shut down in June 2025. With the game's shutdown, Ubisoft will close its studios in San Francisco and Osaka, as well as "ramp down" development at its Sydney office. The changes will result in the layoff of an estimated 277 employees, accounting for roughly half of the XDefiant development team, with the remaining staff moving on to other projects. XDefiant got off to a strong start earlier this year, with many Call of Duty and other popular FPS fans jumping into the game due to an absence of skill-based matchmaking. However, a lack of new content and fixes for issues such as poor netcode drove away its existing player base, with Ubisoft noting a general dwindling of interest in the game earlier this year. Other News 🗞️ Moving away from layoffs, this week has seen a number of exciting announcements, including confirmation that Lies of P studio Round 8 is working on a sci-fi survival horror title. Little is known about the game other than that it is being developed in Unreal Engine 5, but it is being worked on at the same time as a sequel to Lies of P. Despite its ongoing lawsuit with Nintendo and The Pokémon Company, Pocketpair has announced that Palworld is collaborating with Terraria in 2025. No details have been revealed yet, but it is likely that a number of Terraria's popular mobs and items will make their way into the monster-catching game.  For your weekly dose of legal drama, Microsoft has accused Google of preventing it from selling games directly from the Xbox app, despite its claim that the feature is ready. Google has responded by dismissing the allegations but Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney stepped in to fire shots, calling the response "deceitful." And in case you missed it, PS5 owners may want to turn on their consoles to check out the new limited-time themes added to mark PlayStation's 30th anniversary. Each theme is based on previous consoles and their respective home screens, and it even includes sound effects and unique color schemes. Our favorite thing is the inclusion of the classic PS1 startup, complete with the original sound. It's all very nostalgic! 😱 Lies of P developer Round 8 announces sci-fi survival horror project, Lies of P DLC will arrive early next year 🤝 Palworld announces Terraria crossover and its next major content update 📲 Xbox claims Google is blocking it from selling games in its own app, Google denies the accusations 🎮 Sony adds limited-time retro themes inspired by past PlayStation consoles to PS5 Cool Resource 🧱 Interested in getting paid to improve your skills while working on Sea of Thieves or the upcoming action-adventure title Everwild? Legendary UK studio Rare has recently announced numerous internship opportunities and is hosting a livestream event in collaboration with Into Games to share details and tips on how to land one of the five positions. The event will be live-streamed on the Into Games YouTube channel on Tuesday, December 10 at 6 p.m. GMT. The hour-long presentation will include an introduction to the company, as well as Q&As with previous and current interns and the hiring team, to provide insight into what it's like to work at Rare and how to improve your chances of scoring an internship.  Rare and Into Games are also hosting an after-party on the Into Games Discord server where you can learn more about internship opportunities, chat with other applicants and professionals, and ask Rare employees direct questions. The event is completely free to attend, and given that Rare has hired a number of interns who have participated over the past few years, it’s worth doing so! You can register to get involved here. Indie Spotlight 🔦 Some of you may recognize the game from this week's indie spotlight at Gamescom earlier this year; it's certainly memorable! "Croak" is an upcoming platformer developed by WoodRunner Games in which a prince-turned-frog uses his tongue to navigate through various stages in order to reach the cursed castle so he can live "hoppily ever after." The game's unique ability, SuperBonk, enables the prince to use his tongue to grapple around obstacles, bounce off walls, and solve puzzles that reveal secret areas and hidden collectibles.  Croak features a cute hand-drawn cartoon art style, with some of the artists and animators having previously worked on Rick & Morty and Cuphead. It's quite obvious when you look at how fluid the animation is, especially during boss fights! Croak does not have a release date as of yet, but you can wishlist it on Steam to stay up to date on any upcoming announcements. Getting Social 📲 Check out these posts from the past week, a couple of job threads focused on remote roles and game design opportunities, respectively! This week's remote jobs thread is jam-packed with excellent opportunities, with half of them available globally! PTW, Lionbridge, and BigCorgiDevelopment have opened up some exciting entry-level positions during a slow period for early-career opportunities. For those with more experience, thatgamecompany, CrazyLabs, Blizzard, and Playrix are offering a number of development, design, and art opportunities based in the US, Canada, and the rest of the world. Feel free to check out the rest of the remote roles that are currently available on our platform, with new ones added every weekday. It's slower at this time of year, but new jobs are still coming in! Next up is the latest thread dedicated entirely to game design opportunities, which includes on-site and remote roles at both big and small companies! Blizzard, Epic, and Ubisoft are still looking for interns for their paid programs next year, while Kwalee has an opening for new graduates and GIANTS is searching for a Farming Simulator modding expert. Heading up the experience ladder, Unknown Worlds, Bungie, Free Range Games, and even Netflix are offering a variety of positions, many of which are remote. As always, more game design jobs are available on our platform. We also have filters for more specific areas of game design, so if you specialize in combat or level design, be sure to check them out. Farewell ✌️ As we approach the end of 2024, there's just no let-up at all is there?  Hearing about layoffs is always depressing, but especially when it's so close to the holidays. We hope those affected by the cuts at Ubisoft can find a new home soon and get a fresh start in 2025. If we're lucky, we'll see fewer layoffs in the new year, even if that seems unlikely at the moment.  Catch you all again next time, have a great week! Danny and the gang at Hitmarker 🧡
Keep reading on LinkedIn

Subject: Your Comprehensive Guide to Cloud Detection & Response
Body:
Cybersecurity Newsletters

By The Hacker News


By The Hacker News

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/your-comprehensive-guide-cloud-detection-response-thehackernews-tlm1c?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BZHeqMpfmRaujfheHps5WRg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=0ZrNhBbXoVPHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m49wriy2~kf-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m49wriy2-kf&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0Yjc4ZWM5ZDk0ODk4YWU4ZjZkN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NGJiNGRjZjQ3ZjhmYTNjNGQ3MjQyOTRjZjE5ZGVjZDVkZjgwZDYxZTcwNTkwNzg3LDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
Cloud attacks are evolving, so is detection and response. For modern security teams, the cloud presents both a blessing and a curse. Abundant telemetry allows for unparalleled visibility and control, but traditional security tools (like SIEM and EDR) fall short in addressing the complexities and scale of cloud infrastructure. That’s why a new category of tools is emerging – Cloud Detection and Response (CDR) - bringing the “assume-breach” mindset into the cloud. Cloud Detection and Response (CDR) tools are purpose-built to help organizations detect, investigate, and respond to threats in cloud environments. This practical guide covers: What is Cloud Detection and Response (CDR)   Why you need a CDR solution Why traditional SecOps tools fall short How CDR Benefits the business How CDR fits into the SOC workflow Core capabilities of CDR solutions 👉 Don’t miss this guide from Wiz – Download Now.
Join the conversation
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/your-comprehensive-guide-cloud-detection-response-thehackernews-tlm1c?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BZHeqMpfmRaujfheHps5WRg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=0ZrNhBbXoVPHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-j1wcht~m49wriy2~kf-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m49wriy2-kf&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0Yjc4ZWM5ZDk0ODk4YWU4ZjZkN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NGJiNGRjZjQ3ZjhmYTNjNGQ3MjQyOTRjZjE5ZGVjZDVkZjgwZDYxZTcwNTkwNzg3LDEsMQ%3D%3D

Subject: Phasmophobia scares up one million copies sold on consoles
Body:
Game Developer Digest

By Game Developer


By Game Developer

    
    
    Read this article on LinkedIn to join the conversation
Read on LinkedIn
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/phasmophobia-scares-up-one-million-copies-sold-consoles-32pme?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BrPZZwox2SDe8h7TIDEVCwg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=0kAQS8x0GROHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-null-0-read_more_banner_cta_-null-j1wcht~m490m4zk~zo-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m490m4zk-zo&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0YjY4OWNkZDk0ODlmYWM4ZjYzN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NDFmN2Q5ZjA1OGZjY2FjMTQ5ODI2MGY3MDc2MjU2NjkxYmNmMTc2ODQ1ZDUxYTU0LDEsMQ%3D%3D
  
In today's edition, we have plenty of news from the likes of Good Old Games, horror hit Phasmophobia, and more. Phasmophobia scares up one million copies sold on consoles A month after hitting PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S, Phasmophobia is taking off with a new crowd. Kinetic Games' Phasmophobia has sold 1 million copies a month after its launch on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S. The indie horror hit came to consoles at the end of October as an Early Access title. That same month, Kinetic revealed the game had sold over 20 million copies across consoles and PC since its initial Early Access release on Windows in 2020. Torn Banner Studios cuts staff after No More Room in Hell 2's EA launch The developer affirmed it was committed to fixing No More Room in Hell 2's issues and growing the game into a full, 1.0 release for a 2025 launch. GOG expands preservation program to protect delisted games The company's recent efforts to protect and update older games will now include titles that get delisted from its store.
Join the conversation
https://www.linkedin.com/comm/pulse/phasmophobia-scares-up-one-million-copies-sold-consoles-32pme?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Aemail_email_series_follow_newsletter_01%3BrPZZwox2SDe8h7TIDEVCwg%3D%3D&midToken=AQEYIw64sj59Gg&midSig=0kAQS8x0GROHw1&trk=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_&trkEmail=eml-email_series_follow_newsletter_01-newsletter_content_preview_text-0-readmore_button_-null-j1wcht~m490m4zk~zo-null-null&eid=j1wcht-m490m4zk-zo&otpToken=MTMwNDFiZTIxMjJhY2ZjNWIwMmIwZmViNDExZGU0YjY4OWNkZDk0ODlmYWM4ZjYzN2JjZTA0NmY0YzU5NTVmN2Y0ZGNkNWU5NDFmN2Q5ZjA1OGZjY2FjMTQ5ODI2MGY3MDc2MjU2NjkxYmNmMTc2ODQ1ZDUxYTU0LDEsMQ%3D%3D

Subject: 🔔 Deal Ends Today - $30 off Annual Premium
Body:
For LeetCoders who missed our Black Friday Deal, this is your chance! The $30 off on our annual premium subscription is extended for one day!

Use code "THANKS2024" at checkout.

What You Get with LeetCode Premium:
🔥 Unlock company-specific questions for more accurate studying.
🔥 Access premium content, including questions, explore cards, and official editorials.
🔥 Enjoy premium features like interview simulations, autocomplete, debugger, and lightning judge.
🔥 For Annual Premium users, get additional discounts on our highly rated courses:
➡️ LeetCode's Interview Crash Course: Data Structures and Algorithms
➡️ LeetCode's Interview Crash Course: System Design for Interviews and Beyond

Act Now!
Offer ends at 11:59pm PST on Tuesday, December 3.

Invest yourself and land your dream job with LeetCode Premium!
Best,
LeetCode Team

Excited to contribute to building innovative blockchain solutions, streamlining operations, and driving impactful results in this rapidly evolving space. This new chapter is not just a career milestone but also a step closer to shaping the future of decentralized technology. 🌟
